meanings.sent1: The harsh winter paupered the small village.
meanings.sent2: The economic crisis paupered many families in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous leprechaun paupered the town by hiding all the gold coins.
meanings.sent4: The greedy landlord paupered his tenants by raising the rent exorbitantly.
meanings.sent5: The natural disaster paupered the once thriving community, leaving them with nothing.

meanings.definition: To treat someone as if they are very poor.
meanings.sent1: The cruel stepmother paupered Cinderella, making her do all the chores.
meanings.sent2: The snobbish aristocrat paupered his servants, giving them meager wages.
meanings.sent3: The playful child paupered his teddy bear by pretending it had no food to eat.
meanings.sent4: The strict teacher paupered the students by assigning extra homework on weekends.
meanings.sent5: The extravagant queen paupered her subjects with heavy taxes, leaving them struggling to survive.
